thread.title: Reason why EastEnders isn't airing on Friday revealed - so fans have to wait a little longer for outcome of revenge porn plot
thread.title_full: Reason why EastEnders isn't airing on Friday revealed - so fans have to wait a little longer for outcome of revenge porn plot

author: Hayley Minn
title: Reason why EastEnders isn't airing on Friday revealed - so fans have to wait a little longer for outcome of revenge porn plot
text:
Martin is up and about days after being crushed by a bus Share this video Watch Next We NEED to know what Max Branning is up to after this mysterious scene last night (Photo: BBC) Fans have to wait until Monday for the next development in Max's secretive chat (Photo: BBC) Read More Did Max Branning cause the entire EastEnders bus crash? Jake Wood's character makes shocking confession 
Fans had been hoping for an update in the dramatic Albert Square bus crash storyline. 
Fans on social media were so desperate to find out just what Max is up to - and whether anyone else had perished in the bus smash that’s already claimed the life of the poor driver . 
Quite a compliment for the writers and cast. Paramedics removed a body bag from the scene on Thursday night - was it the driver's body or somebody else? (Photo: BBC) 
One tweeted: “Damn you FA Cup! Couldn’t cope with the cliffhanger yesterday yet alone 3 days now.” 
Another said: “No EastEnders tomorrow because of football? F**k you football, nobody likes you.” 
A third added: “EastEnders is more important than football.” 
Another viewer confessed: "I used to be a big footie fan but I'd much rather watch eastenders tomorrow evening please !!! So much more exciting !!" Whitney and Mick kissed in Thursday's episode - but there's a four day wait until we find out they did next (Photo: BBC) It was touch and go for Whitney for a while (Photo: BBC) 
We can't blame fans for really wanting to know what happens next - it's been a dramatic week in the square, to say the least. 
There's been absolute chaos, following the bus crash that put the whole of Albert Square’s lives at risk. 
But it seems it could all be explained by the return of Max. The bus crash has caused havoc all week 
Viewers of the BBC soap saw Whitney Carter become the final Albert Square resident to be confirmed alive. 
And we all thought everything was fine - other than the bus driver dying - and Max hailed a hero for getting Martin Fowler out from under the bus. 
But then, they hit us out of nowhere with a seeming confession from Max - played by Jake Wood. Read More EastEnder's Lacey Turner looks worse for wear as she smokes with co-stars after celebrating NTAs victory But who was this creepy man? (Photo: BBC) 
He was at The Shard with some creepy man, who was pointing out at East London, telling him he grew up there, and is happy it’s “finally a place people want to live”. 
He then turned to Max, and said: “From what I hear, you’re going big guns.” 
Max replied: “Yeah, getting there.” 
The creepy man asked: “You have connections, is that going to be a problem?” The bus crash has caused havoc all week 
As Max replied no, he asked: “Man after my own heart, you don’t let connections get in way of progress. So what about the pub?” 
Then Max, out of nowhere, replied: “It’s next on my list.” 
Creepy man questioned again: “No second thoughts?” 
And Max finished: “Let it burn for all I care.” Read More But actually he may have made the bus driver cause the crash (Photo: BBC) Insane... (Photo: BBC) 
Did Max pay the bus driver to send the bus in the wrong direction - and if how come he had a heart attack? 
And is Max going to burn down The Vic? 
*EastEnders continues on BBC One on Monday at 8pm Like us on Facebook
